title: Week 1: Exactly how close is the new place?
body: This close: Interestingly enough, I think it takes longer for me to get from building to building in the video than it would in real time (if you ran). Oh well. PS - The rest of the March calendar is finally finished. We put it online last night, and should have print calendars available later this afternoon. Sorry for the delay!
author: Dan

comments.author: DanerKebab
comments.body: Brilliant.  Best part:  your new building is visible from my apartment window!

comments.author: nate
comments.body:
I like the absent minded, lazy, completely fake taps on the projector with the pliers in the first 2 seconds.  That makes the video for me.

Regarding new location:  Quizno's!  Smoothie King!  Ophelia's!  YMCA!!  Awesome.

I will miss Well Fed Head, though, and might be compelled to walk the 3 blocks to it.

comments.author: justin
comments.body: FWIW, the "mending my projector" line is a reference to Will Ferrel as GWB in... this video (Skip to 1:40.)

comments.author: drm00se
comments.body: I caught that reference! I'm trendy and cool! Yes!

comments.author: nate
comments.body: Ah, I see.  I didn't catch it.  I am unfashionable and oblivious to the pop coolchers.

comments.author: dan
comments.body:
My parents told me that my ass looks big in this video. :(

It's true.

comments.author: nicole
comments.body: One of our employees (rhymes with the word "tax") said you run like an overweight kid...

comments.author: drm00se
comments.body: Speaking of employees... are you ever gonna update the employee page again? I'm not new anymore, and there are two people being left out.

comments.author: evilvet
comments.body: Incredible.  Not once during your downtown jaunt were you hit up for spare change OR told that you were condemned to eternal damnation.

comments.author: justin
comments.body: Funny you say that, evilvet, because at Pershing and South, a homeless guy asked us for money.  I have it on film for proof, but I elected not to include it in the video.

comments.author: justin
comments.body: Here's a screencap from the event: In fact, I regularly get asked by this same guy. He always, ALWAYS needs "a few dollars for gas." I don't think he has a car.

comments.author: justin
comments.body: OK, fine, here's a video clip: Few dollars for gas...

comments.author: drm00se
comments.body:
Ha! I've been asked the same thing by that guy several times.

During ArtWalk last week, the religious dudes weren't out, but some kids were standing around on South Street with "Free Hugs" and "Marriage is between two PEOPLE" signs. Good times :-)

comments.author: thewayofthedinosaur
comments.body: You forgot their best sign Der! "I Can Haz Hugz?"
